intro: Illigera pierrei, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Illigera pierrei thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested mountain areas.
